predictions.reasoning: Already closed by maintainer (openclaw-barnacle) with explicit rejection reason: >20 labels + 270 files changed. Greptile flagged as exceeding 100-file review limit. Multiple cross-cutting concerns (18 channel labels + docs + apps + infra) = extremely noisy branch. Author is first-time contributor (0 prior PRs). This is a deterministic closed state.

Small, focused fix (2 files, cli category). Author is first-time contributor but PR is well-scoped with clear intent (timezone handling). Greptile reviewed without blocking. No test label visible, but touching logging/cli core. Category (cli) has 328 PRs historically. Clean scope + no blockers → mid-high merge likelihood despite new author.

Critical red flags: 617 files changed (XL), 18 labels (extremely noisy), author has 1 prior PR with 0 merges (0% history), marked 'invalid' label. Greptile found structural issue: `BrowserActRequest` is tagged union but `profile` field injected at top level without schema validation. Comment cut off but suggests P1 severity bug. Scope creep + schema mismatch + invalid label = high rejection confidence.

Identical author (jessy2027) to PR#8040 with identical catastrophic profile: 640 files, 18 labels, 0 prior merges (0% rate), 'invalid' label. Clawdinator bot (maintainer bot) engagement suggests triage rejection. Despite title claiming 'regression test', the massive file count + noisy label set + author's poor history + invalid marking = deterministic close. Likely spam or misconfigured branch.

Strong signals: author Glucksberg has 12 prior PRs with 16.7% merge rate (above baseline for experienced contributors), single category (agents), 2 files only (focused scope), has approval from quotentiroler with clear positive review ('Solid improvement'). Greptile provided constructive feedback (pre-increment logging) which author addressed transparently. No blockers, good engagement, reasonable scope.

Strong merge signals: MEMBER approval (thewilloftheshadow with 😍 reaction + explicit land comments). Author addressed Greptile feedback (DM authorization checks). Small scope (5 files, discord channel only). Member explicitly landed PR with test commands + merge commit notation. This appears already merged based on member comments. First-time author but with strong maintainer backing and evidence of resolution.

Author WeatherPal-AI has 19 prior PRs with 0 merged (0% merge rate) = deterministic low-merge pattern (is_low_merge_author=true). While PR itself is small (1 file, unit test only) and scoped, author history is catastrophic red flag. Test-only additions to non-critical path (utils/directive-tags.test.ts) without visible label support or maintainer engagement. Greptile review without approval. Low author credibility overrides small scope.

Moderate merge likelihood: medium scope (3 files, labeled 'size: M'), clear intent (cron error isolation), focused category (cron/scheduling). Author MarvinDontPanic has 2 prior PRs with 0 merges but newer authors on small fixes show better outcomes. No test label visible but touching test file suggests coverage. Greptile review without blockers. Size:M label has good historical merge rate (~24%). No strong maintainer signals but no rejections either.

Good merge signals: size: XS label (strong category), small scope (5 files), focused on session path resolution (gateway/agents). MEMBER comment (gumadeiras) with positive 'Thanks!' is implicit approval. Author Limitless2023 is first-time contributor but second PR (#17252 shows 21 priors, 4.8% rate for same author — likely account issue or name variation). XS size + member engagement + focused scope → high merge likelihood.

Author explicitly closed this PR with comment: 'Closing — missing private chat check for stickers. Will revisit with a more complete fix.' Critical bug identified by Lukavyi (contributor): PR breaks Telegram DM topics because private chats DO support forum topics since Bot API 9.3. Author's fix was incomplete (missed stickers case). Greptile also flagged missing check in sendMessageTelegram. Author acknowledged and closed proactively.

Explicit maintainer comment (vignesh07/CONTRIBUTOR) states PR is being closed because functionality is superseded by later changes on main. Author is first-time contributor (0 prior PRs). Approval from Ari4ka is overridden by maintainer's supersession closure.

Member comment (sebslight) contains period + 'If this is incorrect, comment and we can reopen' pattern, suggesting PR was closed. First-time contributor (0 prior PRs). Small scope (1 file) but lack of engagement/approval signals low merge likelihood.

Greptile review identifies unresolved issue: overrides/pnpm.overrides out of sync (P2 severity). Author has 1 prior PR, 0 merged (0% merge rate). No approval or resolution of raised concerns. Dependency update PRs require clean review.

Greptile identifies critical issue: 'Double-respond after ACK' bug in chat.ts before audio validation. No approval despite 5 files changed. First-time contributor (0 prior PRs). Gateway changes are high-risk; unresolved blocking issue suggests closure.

This is the successor to PR #9489 (identical files, 23 min apart). Same author now has 1 prior PR (this counts as #2). 4 reviews including stephenapaleo (likely contributor/maintainer). Author self-comments requesting re-review, showing engagement. Gateway + web-ui labels. Greptile comments suggest review iterations happening. More engagement than #9489 signals iterative improvement toward merge.

Clear policy rejection: new skills should go to Clawhub, not core repo.

Author (ciberponk/NONE) explicitly closes as 'Superseded by merged PR #16641 (configurable capture max)'. Author has 9 prior PRs, 0 merged, but clearly states this fixed-value variant is now redundant. Maintainer accepted the more complete solution.

Author (alinaqi/NONE) closes stating 'PR should target alinaqi/openclaw fork instead'. Intentional redirect to fork; not a technical rejection but routing issue. Author has 6 prior PRs, 0 merged. Size L (6 files) on agents category.

Single-file fix for Signal base64 lowercasing issue (data integrity bug). Minimal scope reduces risk. Member approval from sebslight. First-time contributor but targeted fix to specific channel plugin. No tests visible but fix is simple data-handling change.

Single-file fix with XS label. Comments indicate active discussion/debate ('under discussion'), suggesting not yet consensus-ready. Low engagement (2 comments, no reviews with substantive feedback). Greptile review but no approval signal. Timing (2026-02-02) suggests may have stalled.

Docs-only change (skills/tmux/SKILL.md). Already landed via temp rebase per steipete comment ('Landed via temp rebase onto main'). Explicit merge commit reference. High engagement with positive contributor feedback. Clear approval signal. Minimal risk docs update.

High engagement but technical discussions show complexity/rework needed. PR is stale/abandoned for this iteration.
